page.title: 11THE HUNTLY FIRE BRIGADE
page.content: The town of Huntly has one fire station with two fire tenders. The station is manned by part-time fire men on a 24 hour stand-by system. Each man has a radio pager with a range of 7 miles which is activated from the Head quarters in Aberdeen. Huntly has a total of 16 fire men. Both fire tenders carry hoses, ladders ,axes,foam and other equipment. Each mahine carries a crew of 6 men. Most tenders have a water tank large enough to hold 400 gallons of water. The uniform consists of a black jacket and trousers with a black peaked cap, but when attending emergency calls the men wear leggings, a fire jacket, wellington boots and safety helmet. Call outs vary from month to month but on average the Huntly crew answer 60 calls per year.
